content.description: Start pinching a diagonal rail and move right and then up on slopers and edges to the easier topout. Once you have hands above the roof, the problem is V3(from a stand start). Beta dependent body position from the starting moves. Using a heel-cam at the beginning makes the starting move true to the grade. Not using the heel cam is more core intensive and a definite V9.
content.location: On the left hand side of the low roof, facing the road on Boulder 3.

content.description: Crouch start on edges and shelf. Move right handed to 1.5 finger width crimp with the right hand. Catch a heel hook on the shelf and flag the left foot. Reach left to two pinch/side pulls, set feet and fire for the top.
content.location: Right side of boulder 3, on the right side of the low roof.

content.description:
Line up the middle of the main face, very shoulder intensive. 

  Stand start with right hand on a small sharp incut crimp just above head height and left hand on one of several holds to the left at head height.  Move left hand up to a gaston, and reach right to the big hold in the middle of the face, match finish straight over the bulge on the same finish as Powder Puff. 

  The sit start is V11 and starts with left hand on a good pinch, right hand on a crappy side-pull.
content.location: On the middle of the overhanging face by the road.

content.description: Start low on small crimps either making a large move left to the top, or using small intermediate to hit the same ending point. Short and Tall beta is possible.
content.location: On the northwest side of Boulder 3 is an alcove. The problem is on the left side of the alcove, away from the small cave section.

content.description: After crossing the highway, walk down the road, and on your right will be a large chalked boulder, that leans against another boulder. The roof area is where the majority of the problems are. There are other problems on the back northwest side, in an alcove.
